content.description: Straight up a short vertical face on good holds, then traversing up and right in a water groove. Finish on cool thin slab.
content.location: Begins just right of Love Shack. Third bolted line from the left.

content.description: This route originally had only 2 bolts and was really scary. Now it is protected with 6 bolts and has a bolted anchor at the top. Rap with a single 60 meter rope.
content.location: Along the Lake Shore trail just off the Peavine trail.

content.description: Start in the shade in the wide gully with easy moves, then stem and jam your way up the corner crack with the occasional face hold. Â Surmount the pillar with the help of a jughandle off to the right, then scramble back from the edge to build a gear anchor.
content.protection: Singles 0.3 - 3". Doubles in finger sizes if you want to sew it up. Save the 2" and 3" for the anchor, which is in a vertical slot about 5' back from the lip (YOU MUST BUILD A GEAR ANCHOR TO TOPROPE). Bring a long sling to equalize. Not ideal for TR, better to bring up the second and walk off the back of the dome.
content.location: Shady corner under a tree canopy on the far left (west) of the face

climbs.name: Cast Away
climbs.fa: Bill and Michelle Cramer with Mark Uphus

content.description: This is the left most bolted route. Four bolts to a bolted anchor. Two bolts were added after the bold first ascent. This is still a heads up route. Super fun steep slab climbing.
content.location: Along the Lake Shore trail on the west side of Watson Lake.

content.description: South facing wall along the Lakeshore trail just off the Peavine Trail near the east shore of Watson Lake. Routes are steep steep slab climbing with bolt protection with an old school feel.
